page.title: 20Life-styles, Scoutmoor.
page.content: Twentieth century life in this pleasant rural setting remains largely unaffected by the noise, pollution and pace of industrialisation and urbanism. The vast expanses of wild moorland formally much more populated than they are today, seem to impose themselves upon the flavour and character of the area. Increasingly the local population, whilst depending on the nearby urban areas seek the comparative isolation and tranquility of their rural home enviromnent for leisure and recreation. Compiled by the sixth year geography students,{Stand College, } Whitefield, Manchester.
